Sequence Information.Peptide Name: VF16QK (Synthetic AMPs, thanatin analog, XXA, 1S=S, UCSS1a; Derivative: VF16QKSer)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, insects, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 81.25% similar toV16M. R=K: 19%, I=C: 13%.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 1-4 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC 1-2 uM), S. enterica ATCC 14028 (MIC 1-2 uM), Gram+ bacteria S. pyogenes ATCC 19615 (MIC 1 uM), and E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 1 uM).SAR: changes of Cys to Ser (VF16QKSer) led to a loss of antibacterial activity (MIC>16 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Abdullah SJ, Guan JS, Mu Y, Bhattacharjya S.2024
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Mol Sci. 2024 Dec 24;26(1):51. doi: 10.3390/ijms26010051.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Single Disulfide Bond in Host Defense Thanatin Analog Peptides: Antimicrobial Activity, Atomic-Resolution Structures and Target Interactions.
